message.entry: Too many output arguments.
Trellis is not valid.
Operation mode must be specified by a character string.
Decision type must be specified by a character string.
Unknown operation mode passed in.
The decoded message is the only output allowed for the Truncated and Terminated\noperation modes.
Unknown decision type passed in.

PUNCPAT and ERASPAT cannot be both empty arrays. If you would like to use the default values, do not specify these arguments. If you want to specify ERASPAT only, then specify PUNCPAT as an empty array.
ERASPAT cannot be an empty array if PUNCPAT has been specified. If you would like to use the default ERASPAT do not specify this argument.
Number of soft decision bits must be provided for the ''soft'' decision type.
Length of the input code vector must be a multiple of the number of bits in an\n input symbol.
Number of soft decision bits must be a positive scalar integer.
The puncture pattern parameter must be a vector of real or logical values.
The puncture pattern parameter must be a binary vector of 1''s and 0''s only.
The input code length must be an integer multiple of the number of ones in the\npuncture pattern parameter.
The input code length divided by the number of ones in the puncture pattern\ntimes the length of the puncture pattern must be an integer multiple of the number\nof bits in an input symbol.
The puncture pattern parameter must be a binary vector of 1''s and 0''s only. If you want to use the default PUNCPAT, and ERASPAT values, do not specify this parameter.
The erasures pattern parameter must be a vector of real or logical values.
The erasures pattern parameter must be a binary vector of 1''s and 0''s only.
The length of the erasures pattern parameter must be the same as the input code length.
The initial state metrics must be a real vector with length equal to the number\nof states in the specified trellis.

The initial traceback states must be integers between 0 and
(number of states - 1), arranged in a matrix. Its number of rows must equal the
number of states in the specified trellis, and its number of columns must equal
the traceback depth.

The initial traceback inputs must be integers between 0 and
(number of states - 1), arranged in a matrix. Its number of rows must equal the
number of states in the specified trellis, and its number of columns must equal
the traceback depth.
CODE must be a vector of real or logical values.
For hard decision type, CODE must contain only binary values.
For soft decision type, CODE must contain only integers between 0 and 2^NSDEC-1.
Traceback depth must be a positive integer scalar.
For the ''term'' and ''trunc'' modes, traceback depth must be a positive integer scalar not larger than the number of input symbols in CODE.
When using [] as the default for INIT_METRIC, INIT_STATES and INIT_INPUTS must\nalso be [].
When using [] as the default for INIT_STATES, INIT_METRIC and INIT_INPUTS must\nalso be [].
When using [] as the default for INIT_INPUTS, INIT_METRIC and INIT_STATES must\nalso be [].
Invalid syntax. Too many input arguments.
